actions.content:
DriveON Pro — Zite Build Brief
1) Project goals

Look/feel like a real mobile mechanic shop in OKC (trust first).

Separate Find a Mechanic directory page that lists city pages.

Sleek, modern, light background, minimal sections, ultra-simple UI.

One-tap actions: Call, Open local page (subdomain), optional Text.

2) Pages & IA

Home (/) — “DriveON Pro Solutions — Mobile Mechanics | OKC Metro”

Find a Mechanic (/find) — searchable list of partner mechanics

(Optional) /about and /contact later; keep nav minimal for now

3) Home page (light theme, minimal)

Sections (exact order, each short):

Header (sticky, light)

Left: wordmark “DriveON Pro”

Right nav: Home · Find a Mechanic (button)

Hero

H1: “Mobile Mechanics in Oklahoma City”

Sub: “Fast, honest, on-site repairs across the OKC Metro.”

Buttons: Call Now (tel:+1405XXXXXXX) · Find a Mechanic (link to /find)

Supporting visual: light illustration or clean vehicle/photo (no heavy clutter)

Three trust tiles

“On-site service” · “Upfront pricing” · “Licensed & insured”

Service snapshot (single row of pills)

“Diagnostics” · “Brakes” · “Batteries” · “Starters/Alternators” · “Oil & Fluids”

Location strip

“Serving: OKC, Edmond, Moore, Norman, Yukon, Midwest City”

CTA band

Button Call Now (primary) and Find a Mechanic (secondary)

Style

Background: #f7fafc to white

Text: slate/neutral (e.g., #0f172a)

Accent: green/blue gradient (subtle), rounded corners, soft shadows

Font: Inter/modern san-serif, roomy line-height

4) Find a Mechanic page (/find)

Header: Title + short line “Tap to call or open their city page.”
Controls (single row): Search input + Sort dropdown (Name A–Z, Area A–Z).
List item layout (card):

Name (bold) — e.g., “DriveON Pro — OKC Metro”

Area — e.g., “Oklahoma City Metro” (or subdomain label)

Actions (buttons): Call (tel: sanitized) · Open Page (links to https://{subdomain}.driveonpro.com or a provided page_url)

Cards use light background, thin border, rounded corners; stack on mobile.

Empty state: “No mechanics found.”
Footer CTA: “Want to be listed? Email hello@driveonpro.com
”

5) Data model (for the directory)

Zite can store as a simple collection or a JSON file.

[
  {
    "name": "DriveON Pro — OKC Metro",
    "area": "Oklahoma City Metro",
    "subdomain": "okc",
    "phone": "+1 (405) 555-0100",
    "page_url": ""   // optional; if present, use this instead of subdomain URL
  }
]


URL logic:

If page_url present → use it.

Else if subdomain present → https://{subdomain}.driveonpro.com

Else → disable “Open Page” button.

6) Components Zite must provide

Global Header (sticky, light) with two links

Primary Button (filled), Secondary Button (outline)

Search input + Sort select

List/Card with responsive grid (1 col mobile, 2–3 cols desktop)

LocalStorage or Zite’s data store to manage the listing data (import/export optional)

Phone sanitizer for tel: links (strip non-digits except leading “+”)

7) UX rules

Mobile-first: large tap targets (44px min), sticky header, short sections

Keep copy tight; avoid walls of text

Avoid carousels; use a single hero image or simple illustration

Use one accent gradient for brand cohesion

Performance: compressed images, lazy where needed, no heavy JS

8) SEO essentials (static friendly)

Home <title>: “Mobile Mechanics in Oklahoma City | DriveON Pro Solutions”

Home <meta name="description">: “On-site auto repair across the OKC Metro. Tap to call or find a mechanic nearby.”

Find page title/description similarly concise

OG tags for link previews (image, title, description)

JSON-LD LocalBusiness (OKC) on Home with service area in areaServed

9) Copy you can drop in now

Hero H1: Mobile Mechanics in Oklahoma City
Sub: Fast, honest, on-site repairs across the OKC Metro.
Primary CTA: Call Now
Secondary CTA: Find a Mechanic
Trust tiles: Upfront pricing — On-site repairs — Licensed & insured
Service pills: Diagnostics · Brakes · Batteries · Starters/Alternators · Oil & Fluids
Location line: Serving OKC, Edmond, Moore, Norman, Yukon, Midwest City

10) Visual system (light)

Background: #ffffff → #f7fafc

Text: #0f172a (headings), #475569 (muted)

Accent gradient: green → blue (#22c55e → #60a5fa)

Borders: #e5e7eb

Radius: 14–16px, soft shadows only

11) Acceptance criteria

Home loads fast (<1s on decent mobile), Lighthouse >90 Perf

Button Find a Mechanic goes to /find

Directory search + sort work client-side

Each card shows Name, Area, Call, Open Page

“Open Page” correctly builds URL from page_url or subdomain

Fully responsive (mobile first), accessible labels on inputs/buttons

12) Optional (nice to have, not required)

Simple admin view (LocalStorage) to add/edit listings and export JSON

“Near Me” button using geolocation later

PWA manifest for “Add to Home Screen” (icon, name, theme color)

If you want, I can also export this exact spec as a single HTML starter (light theme) that Zite can import, or a tiny JSON seed file with your first cities (OKC, Tulsa, Enid, Lawton) ready to go.

You said:
Does it require a database?
ChatGPT said:

Nope — it doesn’t need a database at all if you build it like we planned.

Here’s why 👇

💾 1. It’s static (no backend)

Everything (homepage + find mechanic page + data) can live as plain HTML/CSS/JS.
That means:

You can host it on Netlify, Vercel, GitHub Pages, Zite, or any static host.

The listings data (mechanic name, city, phone, URL) can be stored as:

A JSON file (like mechanics.json), or

Inside the browser’s LocalStorage (editable via your dashboard).

No server, no database engine.
